Worked Solution

Two vectors are considered equivalent if they describe the same "movement" â€” that is, they have the same horizontal change (component \(x\)) and vertical change (component \(y\)).

Step 1: Find the components of the given vector \(\vec{p_1p_2}\).

We calculate how far we move from \(p_1\) to \(p_2\):

  • Horizontal change (\(\Delta x\)): \( {@p2x@} - ({@p1x@}) = \mathbf{@v1[1]@} \)
  • Vertical change (\(\Delta y\)): \( {@p2y@} - ({@p1y@}) = \mathbf{@v1[2]@} \)

So, the vector is \(\mathbf{v} = \begin{pmatrix} {@v1[1]@} \\ {@v1[2]@} \end{pmatrix}\).

Step 2: Position \(\vec{p_3p_4}\).

The vector \(\vec{p_3p_4}\) must have these exact same components.

Since the starting point \(p_3\) is fixed at the origin \((0,0)\), the endpoint \(p_4\) is simply the coordinates given by the vector components:

\[ p_4 = (0 + {@v1[1]@}, 0 + {@v1[2]@}) = ({@v1[1]@}, {@v1[2]@}) \]

The diagram below shows the correct position. The blue arrow is the original vector, and the green arrow is the solution.

Draw the Reference Vector p1->p2 (Blue) var p1 = board.create('point', {#p1#}, { name : 'p_1', fixed: true, size: 3, color: '#004499', label:{offset:[-10,-10]} }); var p2 = board.create('point', {#p2#}, { name : 'p_2', fixed: true, size: 3, color: '#004499' }); board.create('arrow', [p1, p2], { fixed: true, strokeWidth: 4, strokeOpacity: 0.6, color: '#004499' }); // 2. Draw the Solution Vector p3->p4 (Green) var p3 = board.create('point', {#p3#}, { name : 'p_3', fixed: true, snapSizeX: 0.5, snapSizeY: 0.5, snapToGrid: true }); // Calculate correct p4 position: p3 + vector components var p4_x = {#p3x#} + {#v1[1]#}; var p4_y = {#p3y#} + {#v1[2]#}; var p4 = board.create('point', [p4_x, p4_y], { name : 'p_4', fixed: true, size: 3, color: '#008800' }); board.create('arrow', [p3, p4], { fixed: true, strokeWidth: 4, strokeOpacity: 0.8, color: '#008800' }); [[/jsxgraph]]

Daniel Murunga

JSXGraph interactive task. Given a random reference vector p1p2 (blue), the student must move point p4 (connected to fixed origin p3) to create an equivalent vector p3p4. Checks if relative coordinates [p4-p3] match [p2-p1].
